intro: Aganisia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian aganisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. It features compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance and small white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
